item.title: Financing Common Crawl
item.description: Mozilla recently published an excellent new report out about Common Crawl, the non-profit whose web scrapes have played an important role in the development of numerous large language models (LLMs). Written by Stefan Baack and Mozilla Insights, the report is based on both public documents and new interviews with the current director and crawl engineer, and goes into some detail about the history of the organization, and how its data is being used.

item.title: Hacking LLM bots
item.description: For anyone who missed it, a Twitter account named @mkualquiera recently deployed what seems like a kind of adversarial attack in the wild on a large language model (LLM)-based Twitter bot.
